tit.e: The Naniwa-zu (Waka [a traditional Japanese poem of 31 syllables] composed by Wani)

sen.j: 難波津の歌（なにわづのうた）は、古今和歌集の仮名序で「おほささきのみかどをそへたてまつれるうた」として紹介されている王仁の和歌。
sen.e: 'The Naniwa-zu no poem' appears in the kanajo (a preface written in kana) of the "Kokin wakashu" (Collection of Ancient and Modern Poems) as 'the poem written on the emperor of Osazaki' composed by Wani (Wang In).
sen.cmt: 原文「難波津の歌」の部分は括弧なしですが、訳出では非常にわかりにくくなってしまうため、'でくくりました（以下同じ）
sen.e: 'The Naniwa-zu no poem' appears in the kanajo (a preface written in kana) of the "Kokin Wakashu" (Collection of Ancient and Modern Poems) as 'the poem written on the emperor of Osazaki' composed by Wani (Wang In).

The Naniwa-zu no uta (waka of Naniwa-zu Port) appears in the Kanajo (Japanese preface) of Kokin Wakashu (Collection of Ancient and Modern Poems) as 'the poem written on the emperor of Osazaki' composed by Wani (Wang In).

sen.j: 応神天皇の死後、菟道稚郎子（うじのわきいらつこ）皇子と大雀命（おおさざきのみこと）が互いに譲り合ったため3年間空位となっていた。
sen.e: After the death of the Emperor Ojin, Prince Uji no Waki-iratsuko and Osazaki no Mikoto (Prince Osazaki) had been trying to convince each other to ascend the throne, and it had been vacant for three years.

sen.e: After the death of Emperor Ojin, Prince Uji no Waki-iratsuko and Osazaki no Mikoto (Prince Osazaki) tried to convince each other to ascend to the throne, but it lay vacant for three years.

sen.j: 皇位に大雀命が就き、仁徳天皇となった際にその治世の繁栄を願った歌と言われる。
sen.e: In the end, Osazaki no Mikoto acceded to the throne and became the Emperor Nintoku, and this poem is said to have been composed then to pray for prosperity in his reign.

sen.j: 仮名序で安積山の歌と並んで「手習ふ人のはじめにもしける」と言われたように、古来書道の初学としても用いられた。
sen.e: As the kanajo says of this poem, alongside the poem of Mt. Asaka, 'people who practice writing with the brush will start from this', it was a poem that had traditionally been used by those starting the study of calligraphy.
sen.cmt: 原文中「仮名序で歌枕の一覧現福島県」とありましたがウェブ参照したところ「歌枕の一覧現福島県」の部分はウェブ原文中の「安積山の歌」のリンク先でしたので、その部分のみＷｅｂ記事と置き換えて訳しました。
sen.e: As the kanajo says of this poem, alongside the poem of Mt. Asaka, 'people who practice writing with a brush will start from this', it was a poem traditionally used by those starting the study of calligraphy.

sen.j: 実際に徳島県の観音寺遺跡から、万葉仮名で「奈尓波ツ尓昨久矢己乃波奈」と記された7世紀の ものとみられる習書木簡が 出土しているのをはじめ、各地から数多くこの歌を記した木簡が出土している。
sen.e: In fact, starting with a shusho mokkan (a wooden tablet used for writing practice) unearthed from the ruins of Kannonji in Tokushima Prefecture, likely the product of the seventh century, which had written upon it in Manyo-gana (a form of syllabary used in the Manyoshu or Collection of Ten Thousand Leaves) '奈尓波ツ尓昨久矢己乃波奈 (Naniwa-tsu ni Sakuya kono hana)', a lot of wooden tablets with this poem written on it have been unearthed from ruins all over the country.
sen.cmt: 原文の出力に問題がありましたので、ウェブの記事と置き換えました。

sen.j: 平安時代には「難波津の歌」と言えば「誰でも知っている歌」の代名詞とされる。
sen.e: In the Heian period, the 'Naniwa-zu no poem' was considered as the epitome of 'a poem which everyone knows'.

sen.j: 競技かるたにおいては競技の開始時に難波津の歌を詠むことが通例となっている。
sen.e: In karuta tournaments, they have a custom of intoning the 'Naniwa-zu no poem' before starting the competition.

sen.j: 難波津に 咲くやこの花 冬ごもり 今は春べと 咲くやこの花
sen.e: Naniwa-zu ni Sakuya/Kono Hana Fuyu-gomori/Ima wa haru-be to/Sakuya kono hana (After lying dormant all winter, the blooming plum blossoms are blazoning now that the spring has come.)
